[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Digital Archival Management System (DAMS) defines requirements for managing, accessing, and sharing digital collections.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: DAMS supports file uploads, metadata, access control, licensing, and search.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: DAMS integrates with Active Directory, metadata harvesters, and APIs.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: DAMS provides web-based file management and licensing.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: DAMS operates on scalable cloud infrastructure.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: DAMS supports REST APIs for integration and metadata harvesting.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: DAMS ensures secure HTTPS data exchange.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: DAMS handles large files and metadata efficiently.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: DAMS ensures 24/7 availability with minimal downtime.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: DAMS supports localized metadata and access control.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: DAMS links to repositories and indexing tools.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: DAMS enables secure uploads, licensing enforcement, and access control.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: DAMS serves archivists, researchers, donors, and administrators.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: DAMS depends on network availability and external services.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: DAMS requires cloud hosting, Active Directory, and archival standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with Active Directory for user authentication.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall provide REST APIs for third-party system integration.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-003: The system shall support metadata harvesters for indexing (REQ-DB-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall enable file uploads with associated metadata (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall enforce licensing and restriction policies for digital files (REQ-DSGN-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall support keyword and tag searches (REQ-DB-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-004: The system shall implement role-based access controls for file management (REQ-ATTR-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive, multilingual user interface (REQ-DSGN-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process file uploads within a short time for files up to 500MB.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall support up to several thousand concurrent users without performance degradation (REQ-ATTR-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store metadata in a structured relational database.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall provide indexed metadata search.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall comply with GDPR regulations and archival preservation standards.
[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-002: The system shall encrypt all data both in transit and at rest.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall adhere to ISO 14721 for digital preservation.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall enforce role-based access control mechanisms.
[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-002: The system shall maintain highly reliable uptime.

[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: Metadata schemas, architecture diagrams, security docs.
